sourcesContent:
import React, { useState } from 'react'; import { ShoppingCart, Package, CreditCard, Truck, Users, Database, Cloud, Layers, MessageSquare, Search, Shield, BarChart3, FileText, Settings, Zap, Globe, Smartphone, Monitor } from 'lucide-react'; const SystemDesign = () => { const [selectedLayer, setSelectedLayer] = useState(null); const [selectedService, setSelectedService] = useState(null); const architectureLayers = { presentation: { title: "Presentation Layer", color: "bg-blue-100 border-blue-300", icon: , description: "Multiple UI touchpoints serving different user experiences", components: [ { name: "Web Application", icon: , desc: "Responsive e-commerce website" }, { name: "Mobile Apps", icon: , desc: "Native iOS/Android applications" }, { name: "Partner Portal", icon: , desc: "Third-party integration interface" } ] }, gateway: { title: "API Gateway & Routing Layer", color: "bg-green-100 border-green-300", icon: , description: "Traffic management, authentication, and request routing", components: [ { name: "Load Balancer", icon: , desc: "Distributes incoming requests" }, { name: "REST API", icon: , desc: "RESTful API endpoints" }, { name: "Circuit Breaker", icon: , desc: "Fault tolerance mechanism" } ] }, microservices: { title: "Microservices Layer", color: "bg-purple-100 border-purple-300", icon: , description: "Independent business capability services", components: [ { name: "Product Catalog", icon: , desc: "Product information management" }, { name: "Shopping Cart", icon: , desc: "Cart and session management" }, { name: "Order Management", icon: , desc: "Order processing workflow" }, { name: "Payment Service", icon: , desc: "Payment processing & billing" }, { name: "Inventory Service", icon: , desc: "Stock management & availability" }, { name: "Shipping Service", icon: , desc: "Logistics & delivery management" }, { name: "User Management", icon: , desc: "Authentication & user profiles" }, { name: "Notification Service", icon: , desc: "Email, SMS, push notifications" } ] }, data: { title: "Data Layer", color: "bg-orange-100 border-orange-300", icon: , description: "Distributed data storage with database-per-service pattern", components: [ { name: "MySQL", icon: , desc: "Order Service, User Management" }, { name: "MongoDB", icon: , desc: "Product Service, Inventory Service" }, { name: "Redis", icon: , desc: "Shopping Cart caching & sessions" }, { name: "Elasticsearch", icon: , desc: "Product search & analytics" } ] } }; const keyPrinciples = [ { title: "Independent Deployment", description: "Each microservice can be developed, tested, and deployed independently without affecting other services.", icon: }, { title: "Database per Service", description: "Each microservice owns its data and database, ensuring loose coupling and data consistency.", icon: }, { title: "API-First Communication", description: "Services communicate through well-defined REST APIs or message queues for loose coupling.", icon: }, { title: "Fault Tolerance", description: "Circuit breakers and bulkhead patterns prevent cascade failures across the system.", icon: } ]; const communicationPatterns = [ { type: "Synchronous", method: "REST APIs", use: "Real-time operations (product search, user authentication)", pros: "Simple, direct communication", cons: "Creates tight coupling, potential latency" }, { type: "Asynchronous", method: "Message Queues", use: "Event-driven operations (order processing, notifications)", pros: "Loose coupling, better fault tolerance", cons: "Complex error handling, eventual consistency" } ]; return (
{/* Header */}

E-commerce Microservices Architecture

Scalable, modular system design for modern e-commerce platforms

{/* Architecture Diagram */}

System Architecture Diagram

Complete E-commerce Microservices Architecture with independent services, databases, and communication patterns

{/* Architecture Overview */}

System Architecture Layers

{Object.entries(architectureLayers).map(([key, layer]) => (
setSelectedLayer(selectedLayer === key ? null : key)} >
{layer.icon}

{layer.title}

{layer.description}

{selectedLayer === key ? 'Click to collapse' : 'Click to expand'}
{selectedLayer === key && (
{layer.components.map((component, idx) => (
{component.icon} {component.name}

{component.desc}

))}
)}
))}
{/* Communication Patterns */}

Communication Patterns

{communicationPatterns.map((pattern, idx) => (
{pattern.type} {pattern.method}

Use case: {pattern.use}

Pros: {pattern.pros}
Cons: {pattern.cons}
))}
{/* Implementation Considerations */}

Implementation Considerations

Best Practices

  • • Start with a monolith and gradually extract services using the Strangler Pattern
  • • Implement comprehensive monitoring and logging across all services
  • • Use containerization (Docker) and orchestration (Kubernetes) for deployment
  • • Implement automated testing for each service and integration points
  • • Design for eventual consistency and handle distributed transaction challenges

Challenges to Address

  • • Increased complexity in service orchestration and management
  • • Network latency and reliability between services
  • • Data consistency across distributed services
  • • Service discovery and configuration management
  • • Distributed debugging and troubleshooting
); }; export default SystemDesign;
